dcterms:creator: X. He
H. Zhang
M.-Y. Kan
T.-S. Chua
dcterms:description: The Yelp dataset consists of user ratings on businesses, specifically the filtered subset created for evaluating item recommendation. Users may rate an item multiple times at different timestamps, and repetitive ratings are merged to the earliest one to avoid testing interactions appearing in the training set.
dcterms:title: Yelp

dcterms:creator: X. Geng
H. Zhang
J. Bian
T. Chua
dcterms:description: The Pinterest dataset is an implicit feedback dataset originally constructed for content-based image recommendation. It is used for evaluating collaborative recommendation on images.
dcterms:title: Pinterest

dcterms:creator: D. Liang
L. Charlin
J. McInerney
D. M. Blei
dcterms:description: The Gowalla dataset is a check-in dataset constructed for item recommendation, where each interaction represents a user's check-in behavior on a venue in a location-based social network. Repetitive check-ins are merged to the earliest check-in.
dcterms:title: Gowalla
